title: Sexual tendencies of MPs make its way into Parliament
byline: The ruling party and the Opposition were engaged in hurling remarks at each other pertaining to sexual tendencies and behaviour.

title: Six-month suspended sentence for sharing friend’s girlfriend’s nude photographs via WhatsApp
byline: A young man who was charged with sharing his friend’s girlfriend’s nude photographs and videos with other friends was sentenced to six months of simple imprisonment, suspended for a period of ten years, by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today.

title: US, Russia and Ukraine to hold security talks in UAE after Putin meeting
byline: Ukrainian, US and Russian officials will hold security talks in the United Arab Emirates on Friday, the Kremlin said, following a meeting of top US negotiators with President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on a US-drafted plan to end the Ukraine war.

title: Dudley Sirisena’s Rolls-Royce gets him into tax mess
byline: While many Sri Lankans struggle with rising prices and a weak economy, some of the country’s wealthy appear to be playing a game of “hide and seek” with tax authorities. The latest case involves business tycoon Dudley Sirisena and his purchase of a Rolls-Royce Phantom 8 Series 2 Extended Wheelbase (EWB, 2025).

title: Is Sri Lanka losing anti-corruption battle?
byline: Despite political rhetoric for eradication of corruption, the situation in Sri Lanka seems to have taken a turn for the worse with the country now ranking 24.7, a drop by 7.3 notches in the Global Corruption Perception Index in 2025 prepared by World Economics which is a UK-based research organization.

title: GMOA launches 48-Hour island-wide symbolic strike
byline: The 48-hour island-wide symbolic strike announced by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) commenced at 8.00 a.m. today, citing the failure to implement written agreements provided by the Health Minister ​to resolve issues affecting the hospital system and medical officers.

title: TikTok clinches deal for new US joint venture to avoid American ban
byline: TikTok’s Chinese owner, ByteDance, on Thursday said it has finalized a deal to establish a majority American-owned joint venture that will secure U.S. data, to avoid a U.S. ban on the short video app used by over 200 million Americans.

title: Three killed in Pelassa embankment collapse
byline: Three persons were killed following the collapse of an earthen embankment at a construction site in the Pelassa area, police said.

title: No Cabinet discussion on removing Attorney General: Justice Minister
byline: Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara said that there has been no discussion within the Cabinet of Ministers regarding the removal of the current Attorney General or the introduction of an impeachment motion against him.

title: Vampire thriller ’Sinners’ sets record with 16 Oscar nominations
byline: ’’Sinners,’’ a Segregation-era vampire thriller starring Michael B. Jordan, stormed into the awards race on Thursday with the most Academy Award nominations of any film this year, landing a record 16 nods.

title: Association of Medical Specialists says No to GMOA strike
byline: Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) has clarified that its members will not participate in any reported trade union action planned by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA), which is expected to commence islandwide tomorrow, January 23, 2026.

title: Market holds steady as earnings season picks up pace
byline: Following yesterday’s exceptional gains, the Colombo Stock Exchange closed on a mixed note today, with the ASPI ending marginally positive while the S&P SL20 finished slightly lower.

title: Presidential Commission calls for public complaints on alleged CMC irregularities
byline: The Presidential Commission of Inquiry appointed to investigate alleged irregularities at the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) has begun calling for public complaints and information relating to the period from 2010 to 2025.

title: Dalai Lama meets Sri Lanka’s Atamasthanadhipathi
byline: In a landmark moment for global Buddhism, a historic meeting took place today between the Most Venerable Dr. Pallegama Hemarathana Nayake Thero, the Atamasthanadhipathi of Sri Lanka, and His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama, the world-renowned icon of universal compassion.

title: Bangladesh adamant on playing T20 World Cup in Sri Lanka despite ICC threat
byline: Bangladesh have reiterated their stance on not travelling to India for the T20 World Cup and will, once again, request the International Cricket Council (ICC) to relocate their games to Sri Lanka despite the global cricket body’s refusal to change the tournament’s schedule.

title: Kendu leaves worth Rs. 15mn seized by Coast Guard
byline: Over Rs.15 million worth of Kendu leaves were taken into custody by the Sri Lanka Coast Guard during a special operation conducted in Katuneriya today (22nd January 2026).

title: Indictments filed against Arjuna Ranatunga, his brother
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption informed Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama that indictments have been filed before the Colombo High Court against former Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation Dhammika Ranatunga

title: Court of Appeal calls for records in Trincomalee monk remand case
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the Registrar of the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court to immediately submit the journal entries and voice recordings relating to the magisterial inquiry into an incident in which two Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thera, were remanded for placing a Buddha statue in Trincomalee.

title: BOI responds to AI-generated video featuring Director General
byline: The Board of Investment of Sri Lanka (BOI) has warned the public and stakeholders of a fraudulent, AI-generated video circulating on social media that falsely features its Director General and Chief Executive Officer, Renuka M. Weerakone.

title: GMOA to launch 48-hour islandwide token strike
byline: A 48-hour token strike will commence at 8.00 a.m. tomorrow at government hospitals across the island, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: Death toll in Pakistan shopping centre fire rises to at least 60
byline: The death toll from a fire at a shopping centre in Karachi has risen to at least 60, after at least 30 bodies were found in a single burned shop, Pakistani officials have said.

title: England wear black armbands in first ODI against Sri Lanka
byline: The England cricket team wear black armbands during today’s first One Day International against Sri Lanka in memory of former England cricketer Norman Gifford and former England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) Chief Executive David Collier.

title: Royal Navy of Oman Ship ‘AL SEEB’ calls Port of Colombo
byline: The Royal Navy of Oman Ship ‘AL SEEB’ arrived at the Port of Colombo on a logistics replenishment visit today. The Sri Lanka Navy welcomed the visiting ship in compliance with naval traditions.

title: Doctors’ strike in Eastern Province called off
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced that the strike launched by doctors at hospitals across the Eastern Province was called off at 2.00 p.m. today.

title: US set to quit World Health Organization
byline: The U.S. is due to officially exit the World Health Organization on Thursday, in the face of warnings it will hit both U.S. health and global health and also in violation of a U.S. law that requires Washington to pay the U.N. health agency $260 million in fees that it owes.

title: New electrician licensing rules implemented this year
byline: The Electrician Licensing System aimed at enhancing electrical safety and professional standards in the electricity sector has been implemented from this year under the provisions of the Sri Lanka Electricity Act and the Sri Lanka Engineering Council Act.

title: Doctors at National Eye Hospital to stage token strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said doctors attached to the National Eye Hospital in Colombo will engage in a token strike today.

title: Three dead in shooting in Australia’s New South Wales
byline: Three people have died after a reported shooting in a small town in New South Wales, Australia, police say.

title: Vulnerable groups warned as air quality worsens
byline: Sri Lanka’s air quality has worsened in several parts of the country with experts advising vulnerable groups to stay cautious and limit strenuous outdoor activities.

title: Ten drivers test positive for drugs in Colombo
byline: Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways Dr. Prasanna Gunasena revealed that 10 out of 56 drivers randomly tested during a mobile drug screening program at Bastian Mawatha Bus Station were found to have used drugs.

title: Anusha Palpita arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Ministry Secretary and Director General Anusha Palpita has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: New circular offers financial aid to disaster-affected businesses
byline: The government has issued a new circular granting additional financial assistance to businesses affected and disrupted by recent disasters, with the aim of restoring livelihoods and improving living conditions in affected communities.

title: CIABOC moves High Court against MP Chamara Sampath
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption informed Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today that indictments have been filed before the High Court against Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake in connection with an investigation into alleged corruption.

title: Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund crosses Rs. 8.5bn
byline: The government’s Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund, established to support recovery efforts after Cyclone Ditwah, has received over Rs. 8.5 billion from local businesses and the public, Finance Ministry Secretary Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma said.

title: Bitter story of Pelwatte, Sevanagala sugar factories
byline: There is a bitter story behind the management of the Pelwatte and Sevanagala sugar factories over the years, even though the sugar they produce is sweet, Chief Government Whip Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today.

title: Prime Minister returns after successful World Economic Forum visit
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya returned to the island this morning (23) following a successful four-day official visit to Switzerland, where she attended the 2026 World Economic Forum (WEF) Annual Meeting in Davos.

title: Colombo Navam Maha Perahera on Jan 31, Feb 1; Sacred Relics exhibition from Feb 4.
byline: The annual Colombo Navam Maha Perahera, along with an exhibition of sacred relics brought from India, will be held at Gangaramaya Vihara in Hunupitiya, featuring grand religious observances, Most Venerable Dr. Kirinde Assaji Thera announced.

title: Court temporarily lifts foreign travel ban on Prasanna Ranatunga
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate, Asanga S. Bodaragama, today ordered the temporary relaxation of the foreign travel ban imposed on former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga.

title: Namal slams Lalkantha, warns against intimidation of state institutions
byline: National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP), Namal Rajapaksa, yesterday launched a sharp attack on JVP leader Lal Kantha, accusing him of attempting to undermine state institutions through threats and intimidation.

title: CAASL to introduce licensing system for drone pilots
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) is set to introduce, for the first time, a licensing system for Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) operators engaged in commercial and professional activities.

title: Gold tops $4,900/oz; silver and platinum extend record‑setting rally
byline: Gold pushed past $4,900 per ounce for the first time on Thursday, powered by ‌ongoing geopolitical tensions, a softer U.S. dollar and expectations of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, while silver and platinum prices hit fresh record highs.

title: Eastern container terminal phase III comes inline
byline: The Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) commenced operations of Phase III of the Eastern Container Terminal (CECT) today (23), marking a key milestone in the government’s programme to develop the Port of Colombo into a regionally competitive maritime hub.

title: Anusha Pelpita remanded
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today ordered that Anusha Pelpita, a former Ministry Secretary and Director General, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, be remanded till February 6 in connection with an investigation into allegations of amassing illicit assets amounting to Rs. 46 million over a period of two years.

title: To Lam wins new term to rule Vietnam for the next five years
byline: Vietnam’s top leader To Lam was reappointed on Friday as head of the ruling Communist Party for the next five years after a unanimous vote by its central committee, as he pledged to turbocharge growth in the export-reliant nation.

title: Circular issued to support livelihood restoration after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: A new circular has been issued to facilitate the restoration of livelihoods of individuals affected by the disaster caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Japan PM Takaichi dissolves parliament, paving way for snap election
byline: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi has dissolved parliament in advance of a snap election scheduled for February 8.

title: Karu urges President to reconsider abolishing MPs’ pensions
byline: Former Speaker of Parliament Karu Jayasuriya has written to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake calling for a reconsideration of the proposal to abolish pensions for Members of Parliament.

title: National steering committee for the elimination of child labour meets
byline: The National Steering Committee for the Elimination of Child Labour (NSCECL) held its first meeting for the year this morning (23) at the auditorium of the General Secretariat of Labour in Narahenpita.

title: Ready to quit once people decide: Harini
byline: Claiming that the Opposition is not required to bring in a no-confidence motion against her, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today she is ready to quit and go home when the people of this country decided that the Prime Minister must change.

title: Parliament approves civil society members to Constitutional Council
byline: Parliament today approved the motion moved by Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya, pertaining to the appointment of three new non-Members of Parliament to the Constitutional Council.

title: Concerns raised over operational readiness of Colombo port’s new eastern terminal berth
byline: The Colombo Port’s top management recently held a ceremonial opening for the third berth at the Eastern Container Terminal, but trade union representatives have expressed concerns about the terminal’s operational readiness.

title: Clear division within government on education reforms: Chamith Wijesundera
byline: There is a clear division in the government with regard to the proposed education reforms, SJB Member of the Sri Jayewardenepura Kotte Municipal Council Chamith Wijesundera said today.

title: Report on sexual harassment of Parliament staff hidden: Sajith
byline: The report of the investigation into the sexual harassment of Parliament staff is being hidden from the MPs, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa told Parliament today.

title: CEB restructuring enters final stage
byline: The restructuring process of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), aimed at meeting the country’s future electricity requirements and achieving national development objectives, has reached its final stage, the CEB said.

title: Market surges as ASPI nears 24,000 mark
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange closed on a strong bullish note today, with both benchmark indices recording notable gains as investor optimism continued to build. The ASPI climbed 142.74 points (+0.60%) to close at 23,956.51, edging closer to the psychologically important 24,000 all-time high level, while the S&P SL20 added 31.65 points (+0.48%) to finish at 6,649.50.

title: “I am no longer engaged in active politics”: Ranil
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe visited Kandy this morning (23) to pay homage to the Chief Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters and obtain their blessings.

title: China to donate 100 electric buses to Sri Lanka
byline: The Chinese government has decided to donate 100 electric buses to Sri Lanka to reduce environmental pollution caused by carbon emissions from fossil fuels.

title: Dudley Sirisena responds to Daily Mirror article on Phantom fiasco
byline: In response to the Daily Mirror article published under the title ’Dudley Sirisena’s Rolls-Royce gets him into tax mess’ which appeared on Friday (23) newspaper, business tycoon Dudley Sirisena has broken his voice silence over the high-profile import of a Rolls-Royce Phantom 8, which has drawn attention not only for its luxury price tag but also for alleged customs violations.
